title: Why is ketchup so hard to pour? - George Zaidan

multiple-choice.question: What is the unusual behavior of ketchup that makes it difficult to pour the exactly right amount?

options.label: A
options.text: Ketchup's viscosity remains constant regardless of force.

options.label: B
options.text: Ketchup's viscosity changes depending on the force applied.

options.label: C
options.text: Ketchup's particles are too large and don't flow easily.

options.label: D
options.text: Ketchup's viscosity is a gas at room temperature.

multiple-choice.question: Which of the following fluids respond to force linearly, according to Sir Isaac Newton's proposal?
What happens to ketchup when a strong force is applied very quickly?

options.label: A
options.text: The ketchup particles get even more evenly distributed.

options.label: B
options.text: The ketchup particles get smushed into little ellipses, allowing them to flow past each other.

options.label: C
options.text: The ketchup particles start to flow slowly.

options.label: D
options.text: The ketchup particles become a solid.

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what are two possible explanations for what happens when a very weak force is applied for a very long time to ketchup?

options.label: A
options.text: The tomato particles slowly get bumped towards the middle, and the water near the edges serves as a lubricant.

options.label: B
options.text: The tomato particles rearrange themselves into lots of small groups, which then flow past each other.

options.label: C
options.text: Both A and B are possible explanations.

options.label: D
options.text: Neither A nor B is a possible explanation.

multiple-choice.question: Which of the following substances is an example of a Non-Newtonian fluid that gets thicker the harder you push?
What is the role of xanthan gum in ketchup?

options.label: B
options.text: It helps to stabilize the mixture.

options.label: C
options.text: It has no effect on the mixture.

multiple-choice.question: How can ketchup be successfully poured from a bottle?

options.label: A
options.text: By shaking the bottle vigorously for a long time.

options.label: B
options.text: By hitting the bottle very hard once.

options.label: C
options.text: By giving the bottle a few short, sharp shakes and then taking the lid off.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main reason why ketchup is difficult to pour?

options.label: B
options.text: Its viscosity changes depending on the force applied.

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, which of the following properties are characteristic of most ketchups?

options.label: A
options.text: Sudden thinning at a threshold force.

options.label: B
options.text: Gradual thinning after a small force is applied for a long time.

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of ketchup being a Non-Newtonian fluid?

options.label: A
options.text: It makes it easier to pour.

options.label: B
options.text: It makes it more difficult to pour.

options.label: C
options.text: It allows for a more controlled pour.

options.label: D
options.text: It has no significant effect on the pour.

options.label: C
options.text: To be invisible to most animals, allowing for unobtrusive observation

multiple-choice.question: What species of shark appears in one of the webcam recordings?
What is the purpose of the burglar alarm display shown in the webcam recording?

options.label: D
options.text: To warn other animals of potential danger, serving as a burglar alarm

multiple-choice.question: Why do some animals in the deep ocean produce light?

options.label: D

multiple-choice.question: What device is used to record deep-sea webcam footage?
What percentage of the living space on our planet is ocean?

options.label: A
options.text: To take a dive in a submersible

options.label: C
options.text: To appreciate the beauty of bioluminescence

options.label: D
options.text: To remember to turn out the lights when taking a dive, as bioluminescence can be addictive

title: Nature's smallest factory: The Calvin cycle - Cathy Symington

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary source of energy for the plant that your cereal came from?

options.label: D
options.text: Carbon dioxide (CO2) from the air and sunlight

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the enzyme that welds one carbon atom from a CO2 molecule with the RuBP chain to build an initial six carbon sequence?
What are the two main steps of photosynthesis?

options.label: A
options.text: The Calvin cycle and the breakdown of glucose

options.label: B
options.text: The capture of carbon and the storage of energy

options.label: C
options.text: The storage of energy from the sun in the form of ATP and the capture of carbon and turn it into sugar

options.label: D
options.text: The breakdown of glucose and the capture of carbon

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary role of ATP in the Calvin cycle?

options.label: A

options.label: D
options.text: To deliver energy and facilitate chemical reactions

options.label: B
options.text: By using a linear production process

options.label: C
options.text: By reusing materials within the cycle and creating feedback loops

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of the Calvin cycle having multiple conveyor belts moving in unison?

options.text: It increases the production of glucose

options.label: B
options.text: It allows for the efficient use of energy

options.label: C
options.text: It enables the recycling of RuBPs

options.label: D
options.text: It increases the efficiency of the cycle

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of welding two G3P molecules together?

options.label: A
options.text: By reusing materials within the cycle and creating feedback loops

options.label: D
options.text: By using a linear production process

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary advantage of biological production processes being cyclic rather than linear?

options.label: B
options.text: They are less successful at using energy to manufacture materials

options.label: D
options.text: They are more efficient and use energy to manufacture materials effectively

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary role of the Calvin cycle in the plant's energy factory?

options.label: A
options.text: To capture carbon and turn it into sugar

options.label: D
options.text: To store energy from the sun in the form of ATP and capture carbon and turn it into sugar

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of the Calvin cycle being one of the hundreds of cycles present in nature?

options.label: C
options.text: It is a vital component of biological production processes and contributes to the efficient use of energy

options.label: D
options.text: It is a waste of energy

title: How many ways can you arrange a deck of cards? - Yannay Khaikin

options.label: D
